in a way that relates to a well-known saying or phrase: We must be living in those “interesting times” often proverbially mentioned. It is proverbially impossible to please everyone.
in a way that is well known or generally believed: Doctors and dentists are proverbially bad investors. By the middle of the 18th century Philadelphia was proverbially the second most populous English-speaking city in the world. See
